content:
It sounds like you're all set for an amazing adventure in Yosemite! 

Just to reiterate, since you'll be driving up to Yosemite National Park solo today, please make sure to:

1. Check the road conditions and weather forecast before you head out.
2. Fill up on gas and make sure your vehicle is in good condition.
3. Bring a map, GPS device, or a reliable navigation system to help you navigate the roads.
4. Let someone know your itinerary, including your expected arrival time and route.
5. Drive safely and take regular breaks to rest and stretch your legs.

For your hike tomorrow, remember to:

1. Check the trail conditions and weather forecast before you head out.
2. Bring all the necessary gear, including water, snacks, sun protection, and layers for changing weather.
3. Let someone know your itinerary, including your expected return time and route.
4. Hike with a buddy if possible, or let someone know your solo hiking plans.
5. Stay on designated trails, follow park rules, and respect the natural environment.

It's great that you're excited to get started early tomorrow! Make sure to get a good night's rest, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or concerns.

Have a safe and enjoyable drive to Yosemite, and an amazing hike in the valley tomorrow!
